Experience Lead Frontend Engineer Google October 2014  – Present (11 months) Hyderabad Area, India My current role as the tech lead and frontend developer involves:- 
Conceptualizing platform/solution specifics for automation pertaining to sales internal automation requirements. 
Define end user experience. 
Estimation time lines and identifying bottlenecks. 
Managing stakeholders. 
Identifying newer technologies and induce their advantages into current systems. 
Plan maintenance, bug handling and upgrades. Business Analyst/Tech Lead Google January 2014  –  October 2014  (10 months) Hyderabad Technical Operations Specialist Google April 2012  –  January 2014  (1 year 10 months) Hyderabad Area, India The Approval Bin team at Google is responsible for verifying the adherence of text ads to Google’s advertising guidelines and policies. The guidelines and policies are in place to ensure good user experience to people viewing ads and to follow the applicable laws in countries where they appear. The team started by manually reviewing each ad and passing approval decision on each one of them. The Technical Operations team is in place to identify automation of the workflow of the approval bin team, conceptualize the solution, execute the plan and test/maintain it with possible upgrades. As a Technical Operations Specialist, my responsibilities include 
•	Identifying scope of automation and efficiency improvement for the Approval Bin team. 
•	Assessing incoming project requests. 
•	Prioritizing projects. 
•	Modular planning of projects and identifying individual tasks in them. 
•	Estimating complexity of tasks and setting deadlines for each task. 
•	Assigning tasks to the tools team members and tracking progress. 
•	Upgrading my knowledge with newer Google/industry technologies and identify implementation of better methods to improve the development/deployment procedure. 
•	Conducting training to upgrade the technical expertise of the fellow team members. 
•	Plan testing of tools by working with the individual workflow leads and gather feedback for upgrades. Developer Relations Specialist Google June 2011  –  April 2012  (11 months) Hyderabad Area, India, Google Checkout is the online payment-processing platform for online purchases. It offers several means of implementation and integration for publishers with their websites like the “Buy Now” button, Store Gadget, Checkout cart, and an XML API. 
 
As a Developer Relations Engineer, my daily job involves engaging with developers around the world and to help them be successful as they build their applications and online stores. The engagement involved exchange of email(s), discussion forums, mailing lists and video based tutorials. The role also involved writing sample code for developers, contributing to open source client libraries and creating tutorials to assist the developers. 
 
Another aspect of the role was to work with the Ops team in Hyderabad. The ops team acts as the first level support for checkout related queries. Approximately 25% of the queries are related to integration. The ops team is not trained to handle technically inclined questions, so my job involved educating them on how certain integration options work, helping them provide the developer with the relevant information and in case of a complex situation, take up the case as an escalation and directly interact with the developer/business owner to help them integrate better with our system and products. I was also instrumental in hiring a team of vendors who would act as the first level of support, and train them. Analyst, Consumer Operations Google November 2005  –  January 2011  (5 years 3 months) To identify bottle necks for Consumer Operations in terms of automation and suggest solutions. 
Develop automated solutions using technologies like PHP, Javascript, Python and MySql. 
Collaborate with the Global Consumer Operations team to device newer methodologies to work with in terms of action plans. 
Support the local automation needs. 
Build/maintain statistics monitoring system for the local vendor teams which acts as a base for resource allocation and performance analysis. Search Quality Associate Google November 2005  –  November 2009  (4 years 1 month) Hyderabad Area, India • Responsible for suggesting penalties to sites violating Google’s Web Master guidelines. 
• Was responsible for working on various analyst projects 
• Worked with the Global Search Quality team on internal tools. 
• Worked as one of the Team Advisors to bring clarity to the knowledge domain of younger team members and helping them grow in the team. Sr. Technical Support Engineer Webhelp May 2003  –  November 2005  (2 years 7 months) I started off working as a Technical Support Engineer providing voice based technical support(laptops) for the US customers. I then moved to providing technical support for Desktops and printers for the US customers. Based on my excellent track record, I was posted as an escalation technician for the team. 
 
The responsibilities of an escalation technician are to identify the issues which were not solvable by other technicians and provide personalized support through callbacks at convenient time. I was awarded the award for Best Escalation technician for achieving the highest amount of customer satisfaction in Hyderabad. Sr. Technical Support Engineer Dell November 2003  –  April 2005  (1 year 6 months) As a Senior Technical Support Engineer, my core responsibilities involved troubleshooting issues with Dell Laptops for customer from the US and Canada. I was also the outbound tech for my time and the responsibilities involved proactively calling customer back to check for any unresolved issues, taking up escalations and getting them resolved. Summary I absolutely love being a Googler and working for such an amazing company that is doing such incredible things for the world we live in! My role at Google primarily revolves around data analysis and marketing outreach follow up, as well as event planning. Experience Sales Development Campaign Manager, Marketing Liaison Google January 2015  – Present (8 months) Austin, Texas Area This new role was established to push higher opportunity and pipeline conversion rates from marketing-engaged prospects. By working together, we were able to harness both marketing’s advanced prospect targeting & demand management’s selling and conversion expertise.  
-Directly influenced $1.9M in pipeline (Q1 2015) 
-Acted as liaison between the marketing and outbound demand management teams 
-Created tracking method for all campaigns where demand management was involved with marketing to ensure proper lead time per campaign and track necessary campaign assets 
-Provided consultation on most effective outbound sales prospecting techniques 
-Developed cadence and repeatable techniques for following up with marketing leads through the demand management team 
-Scrubbed all marketing lists for actionable prospects 
-Developed all follow-up email communication templates 
-Executed campaigns, analyzed process issues and created tools & methods to correct where needed 
 Events Lead Google January 2014  – Present (1 year 8 months) Austin, Texas Area As the owner of the Playtime budget for the Austin office, I am responsible for organizing at least 2 office-wide events a year. This budget is set up to provide non-MTV office locations with more social events to help promote Google culture and office morale. 
-Responsible for at least 2 Austin office events a year 
-Worked within a set budget and tracked all expenses 
-Coordinated with the internal events team to ensure events and expenses were approved Business Analyst, Operations Specialist - Google for Work Google August 2011  – Present (4 years 1 month) Austin, Texas Area As the Operations Specialist on the LCS Inside Sales team, I was responsible for the Salesforce (SFDC) operations activities & data analysis. I was the SFDC expert on the team for best practices & processes. 
-Provided SFDC reporting, dashboarding, campaign management, data uploads, etc. for LCS ISA team 
-Supplied managers with relevant daily, weekly, quarterly & yearly reporting and numbers for communication on team’s performance to higher levels 
-Assisted outside teams (incl. Geo, Vault, Cloud Platform, Search) in ad hoc report, dashboard, campaign, and other SFDC requests 
-Communicated changes & best practices from top down in SFDC process to ISA team and ensure proper SFDC practices 
-Served as liaison for ISA team processes/needs with outside teams  
-Trained new ISAs in SFDC usage and particulars related to our instance and our team's usage 
-Located SFDC process/system problems & worked with the data quality teams to address these issues 
-Managed access for all data sources for Enterprise (Data.com, DiscoverOrg, Avention & Hoovers) 
-Completed mass data uploads & amendments via Lexi Loader tool 
 LCS Sales Development Representative, Strategic Team Google January 2013  –  December 2014  (2 years) Austin, Texas Area In Q1 of 2013, I began supporting the new created Strategic Team in Google for Work, focused on a small set of marquee named accounts with high Google Ads spend. In carving out this new role, I worked to determine the team’s specific needs and how I could best support them in this unique set of accounts. 
-Achieved over 100% of meeting, opportunity & pipeline OKRs each quarter 
-Attained 70% account engagement in 2013 
-Supported 4 sales representatives and about 50 accounts total 
-Assisted the reps in establishing relationships in the accounts across many lines of business

Summary I'm an operations and support specialist with over two decades of experience in managing products, leading teams, and overseeing the client experience. I’m technically minded, and have worn several hats in my past roles; including product manager, webmaster, and graphic designer. I have an old-fashioned work ethic, an eye towards improving existing systems, and empathy with the customer’s needs. 
 
What have I done? 
 
Created documentation for training, client education, and product implementation. 
Worried out new product features from existing internal tools and products. 
Resolved hundreds of customer issues via email support. 
Acted as a go-between for operations, product teams, and engineering. 
Supported products as diverse as online maps, media storefronts, and education programs. 
 
What can I do? 
 
CREATE: organizational systems for tracking and documentation. 
MANAGE: people, teams, tasks, and products. 
DOCUMENT: policies, processes, and training materials. 
RECRUIT: interview candidates and evaluate team members. 
EDUCATE: train and onboard team members. 
 
Now seeking growth opportunities in nurturing environments, with passionate people and rewarding products. Summary Veteran with 9 years experience in Aviation Operations and Operations Planning. Performed my duties and built lasting team oriented relationships across the world. Worked as an administrative clerk for NATO (North Atlantic Treaty Organization) level organizations, and senior executive officers in separate multi-national departments. I have a current Secret Security Clearance, passport, TWIC card, CPR certification, HAZMAT certification, and driver's license. My profession, in the US Army Aviation Branch, focused around planning, acquisitions, and Operations Management. I learned the standards for tactical asset management, and the procedures and the protocol necessary to enforce them ethically and without liability. In addition, I have performed all of the aforementioned duties and tasks on deployments to Afghanistan, Iraq, Poland and all over the United States. I adapt easily to changing circumstances and specialize in operating under high stress conditions in multi-cultural environments.  
 
I am proficient with Microsoft Office products and military communication systems such as CPOF, EVE and BFT. I have experience in strategic team building, research, writing reports, conflict resolution, designing high impact Power Point presentations, administration, and much more. The 12th Combat Aviation Brigade Operations Center (BOC) is an information hub mediating information to and from tactical, operational and strategic levels. My team facilitates, re-structures and distributes information, from higher command, through the appropriate channels to subordinate units.  
The BOC also serves as a response cell for any and all emergency and nonemergency situations concerning the personnel affiliated with 12th CAB.  
 
This position requires an active security clearance, attention to detail, refined organizational skills, and the discipline to work within a team-focused environment. CJ3 Aviation: Operator US Army May 2012  –  March 2013  (11 months) Afghanistan Oversaw personnel and professional development providing purpose and motivation; managed work assignment and performance reviews. I was responsible for the health, morale and welfare and supervision of these soldiers; responsible for ensuring soldiers were proficient in skill level one tasks, and on the job training. Also responsible for the accountability and maintenance of 120 sensitive items, totaling more then 1.2 million dollars. 
 
Assigned as a CJ3 Aviation Operator at Camp Masar-E-Sharif, Afghanistan. I was involved in the tactical application of aviation assets in accordance with the campaign strategies of various Battlespace Owning Units. I provided daily input of aviation requests across multiple provinces and provided support from two distinct Aviation Task Forces. Due to my team's outstanding performance, TF Ready and TF Pirate supported the movement of over 30,000 passengers and over 15 million pounds of cargo for the 16 Coalition Nations operating in RCN Afghanistan.  
 
Secondly, I aided in the coordination, planning and execution of 170 successful special operations involving tactical assets under my unit's command. These tactical assets were positioned in vital support roles to missions supporting fellow NATO military units from Spain, Norway, Germany, Bulgaria, Portugal, and the Netherlands. White Cell Operator NATO January 2013  –  February 2013  (2 months) Bydgoszcz, Kuyavian-Pomeranian District, Poland NATO level tactics and wargaming exercise. In wargaming, the key theme is that the aggressor is composed of various threat actors, equipment and techniques that are at least partially unknown by the defenders. The red cell challenges the operations planning by playing the role of a thinking enemy. In United States war-gaming simulations, the U.S. force is always the Blue Team and the opposing force is always the Red Team. The White Cell’s job is to keep the exercise moving by monitoring game play and entering new input.  
 
This exercise was meant to form a sense of continuity among NATO affiliated military organizations. My specialized team of subject matter experts received accolades from the General Officer level after having organized and planned missions with emissaries and appointed officials from Poland, Germany, Spain, Portugal, and Bulgaria.  
 
As a White Cell Operator, my duties included the following: 
 
1. Administration, personnel and tactical asset management  
2. Building and responding battlefield scenarios.  
3. Operational surveillance and population control 
4. Airspace deconfliction Mission Coordinator (Air Mission Coordinator) US Army May 2010  –  December 2010  (8 months) Iraq Air Mission Coordination Cell: air control agency responsible for the direction of air operations directly supporting ground forces.  
 
The Air Mission Request Cell processes immediate air support requests; coordinates aircraft employment with other supporting arms; manages terminal control assets supporting special operations and combat service support element forces; and controls assigned aircraft, unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), and itinerant aircraft transiting through military controlled airspace. The Air Mission Request Cell controls and directs air support activities that effect the special operations commander's focus on close operations and those air missions requiring integration with the ground combat forces, assault support and designated air reconnaissance.  
 
In addition the Air Mission Request Cell serves as a liason between multiple military factions, echelons, and senior military leadership. White Cell Operator NATO January 2013  –  February 2013  (2 months) Bydgoszcz, Kuyavian-Pomeranian District, Poland NATO level tactics and wargaming exercise. In wargaming, the key theme is that the aggressor is composed of various threat actors, equipment and techniques that are at least partially unknown by the defenders. The red cell challenges the operations planning by playing the role of a thinking enemy. In United States war-gaming simulations, the U.S. force is always the Blue Team and the opposing force is always the Red Team. The White Cell’s job is to keep the exercise moving by monitoring game play and entering new input.  
 
This exercise was meant to form a sense of continuity among NATO affiliated military organizations. My specialized team of subject matter experts received accolades from the General Officer level after having organized and planned missions with emissaries and appointed officials from Poland, Germany, Spain, Portugal, and Bulgaria.  
 
As a White Cell Operator, my duties included the following: 
 
1. Administration, personnel and tactical asset management  
2. Building and responding battlefield scenarios.  
3. Operational surveillance and population control

Summary “When all of your wishes are granted, many of your dreams will be destroyed.”  
-Marilyn Manson 
 
There is my shock factor for my summary, did it make you want to read more?  
 
It is funny but I truly feel this quote sums up the business world. There are constantly new needs in business and goals are always changing; If a business was able to accomplish every goal and grant every wish then what else would we strive for? Business in the tech industry is constantly changing and my job is to adapt and help companies with those changes. I am an analytical people person which can help companies develop their new products and view things from a customer's standpoint, while maintaining the operations and developing workflows to establish solid products and support.
